title: Spare Hours
author: Brown, John
snippet: [18] Well do I remember when driving him from Melrose to Kelso        long ago, we came near Sandyknowe, that grim tower of        Smailholm standing erect like a warder turned to stone,        defying time and change his bursting into that noble        ballad--

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The poet resided for some time, while a boy, at the neighbouring farm-house of Sandyknowe,  then inhabited by his paternal grandfather, and he has beautifully described the scenery in one of his preliminary epistles

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: " He knew well enough that if he hadn't lived at Sandyknowe there would have been no poems or novels.

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: We were on our way to Sandyknowe, to see the region where Sir Walter spent so much of his early childhood.

title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: 1 Well do I remember when driving him from Melrose to Kelso, long ago, we came near Sandyknowe, that grim tower of Smailholm, standing erect like a warder turned to stone, defying time and change, his bursting into that noble ballad —
